{
    "number": 192581,
    "data": "2,4,5,11,17,23,47",
    "name": "Monotonic ordering of set S generated by these rules:  if x and y are in S and xy+1 is a prime, then xy+1 is in S, and 2 and 4 are in S.",
    "comment": [
        "See the discussion at A192580.  As sets, A192580 lies in A192581, which lies in A192582."
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "start = {2, 4}; primes = Table[Prime[n], {n, 1, 10000}];",
        "f[x_, y_] := If[MemberQ[primes, x*y + 1], x*y + 1]",
        "b[x_] :=",
        "  Block[{w = x},",
        "   Select[Union[",
        "     Flatten[AppendTo[w,",
        "       Table[f[w[[i]], w[[j]]], {i, 1, Length[w]}, {j, 1, i}]]]], # <",
        "      50000 &]];",
        "t = FixedPoint[b, start]  (* A192581 *)"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A192476, A192580."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,fini,full",
    "offset": "1,1",
    "author": "_Clark Kimberling_, Jul 04 2011",
    "references": 2,
    "revision": 4,
    "time": "2012-03-30T18:57:35-04:00",
    "created": "2011-07-05T13:00:41-04:00"
}
